Package org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.widget.button

Class CancelableActionHandler<R,S>

java.lang.Object
org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.widget.button.CancelableActionHandler<R,S>
Type Parameters:
R - the type of the returned result. For widgets which set this as the value of the field, the type of the field has to be assignable from it.
S - the type of the settings the invocation depends on.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>, DependencyHandler<S>
public abstract class CancelableActionHandler<R,S> extends Object implements ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>
An ButtonActionHandler with an asynchronous invocation whose result can be retrieved and canceled.

    CancelableActionHandler.UpdateHandler<R,S>
    A simple update handler which will reset the current state of the button to the ready state when a triggering setting changes.

  • Method Details

    • invoke

      protected abstract R invoke(S settings, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context) throws WidgetHandlerException
      An invocation which is triggered if a request which is not a cancel request is sent.
      Parameters:
      settings - the settings the invocation depends on
      context - the current DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext
      Returns:
      the future result.
      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException - if the request should fail providing the error message to the frontend

    • isMultiUse

      protected boolean isMultiUse()
      Returns:
      whether the button should be in an enabled state when the request was successful (i.e. if the "DONE" state should be enabled).

    • getButtonText

      protected abstract String getButtonText(CancelableActionHandler.States state)
      Parameters:
      state - - a field from the associated state machine enum.
      Returns:
      the text that should be displayed for that state. If null is returned, the value of ButtonState.text() from the annotation of the respective state in CancelableActionHandler.States is used instead.

    • invoke

      public ButtonChange<R,CancelableActionHandler.States> invoke(CancelableActionHandler.States buttonState, S settings, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context) throws WidgetHandlerException
      Description copied from interface: ButtonActionHandler
      This method gets called when the button is clicked.
      Specified by:
      invoke in interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>
      Parameters:
      buttonState - a string specified by the frontend in order to reuse the same invocation for multiple uses. E.g. this can be used to cancel an invocation (refer to CancelableActionHandler.
      settings - the settings of type S which the invocation depends on.
      context - the current DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext
      Returns:
      a representation of how the button is going to change or null if no change should happen due to this call.
      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException - if the request should fail providing the error message to the frontend

    • initialize

      public ButtonChange<R,CancelableActionHandler.States> initialize(R currentValue, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context)
      Set the button to the initial "Ready" state
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>
      Parameters:
      currentValue - the current set value of the button field
      context - the current DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext
      Returns:
      the initial state of the button and its value.

    • getStateMachine

      public Class<CancelableActionHandler.States> getStateMachine()
      Description copied from interface: ButtonActionHandler
      The button has an associated state machine defined by the generic type. It is an enum where every enum field needs to have a ButtonState annotations We need the class of this generic type returned by this method in. order to
      1. serialize the state machine (i.e. the enum value and their ButtonState) with the initial data sent to the front-end
      2. map the string parameter sent by the front-end to their respective enum values
      We need this method to make the class of the state
      Specified by:
      getStateMachine in interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>
      Returns:
      the class of the state machine.

    • overrideButtonState

      public ButtonState overrideButtonState(CancelableActionHandler.States state, ButtonState buttonStateAnnotation)
      Description copied from interface: ButtonActionHandler
      Override this method in order to adjust the states of the state machine. This might be useful if the same state machine should be used in different contexts (e.g. with different texts).
      Specified by:
      overrideButtonState in interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,CancelableActionHandler.States>
      Parameters:
      state - enum field from the associated state machine
      buttonStateAnnotation - the ButtonState annotation present at the enum field
      Returns:
      the ButtonState that should be used instead of the annotated one.
